<[[https://aerospace.honeywell.com/]]> QUARTERLY HELICOPTER NEWSLETTER Q3 2017 THE Q3 EDITION The first half of 2017 appears to be strengthening at the core. Most of our leading indicators are showing tangible signs of stabilization- potentially anchoring a healthy recovery in 2018. We anticipate industry momentum to gradually gain steam in the second half of 2017 which will solidify stabilization and return this sensational market back to growth.
In this newsletter, we will update you on:
- How we have enabled a prominent 429 operator to ‘stay connected’ using our Aspire 200 HDR and Go-Direct services which allow for connectivity from the air everywhere in the world, including over cities, mountains and oceans.
- Why the Eagle 407HP is ideal for Law Enforcement missions.
- Our EASA AW139 STC certification for our Aspire 200 Satellite Communications system.
- Our enhanced customer portal, MyAerospace, which was anchored around direct input from you, our customers. These enhancements include improved site navigation, the ability to book repairs online and allows customers to track their orders online.
- Our new multi-phase program to introduce new LED searchlight technology which will be more reliable, use less power and last longer.
As this year progresses, we will be sharing new and exciting product and service enhancements anchored around safety and market differentiation.
Sincerely, Rick Angelo Director of Strategic Marketing: Global Commercial Helicopters <[[1. https://aerospace.honeywell.com/en/news-listing/2017/july/honeywell-powers-first-connected-helicopter-circumnavigation]]>Honeywell Powers First Connected Helicopter Circumnavigation
Honeywell's Connected Aircraft satellite communications are connecting a Bell 429 helicopter during Canada’s first flight around the world. The father-son team are using Honeywell’s Aspire 200 Wi-Fi system and GoDirect™ Cabin Connectivity services to share their journey and stay connected from the air. They operate in diverse terrains and challenging environmental conditions, performing airborne law enforcement and search and rescue missions that are critical to public safety and homeland security. We’ve rebuilt the site from the inside-out using input from Honeywell customers, including helicopter operators, pilots and maintenance chiefs.
